conclusion: There are three sources of liquid at the top labeled A, B, and C. The liquid flows downward and interacts with baffles that direct the flow. At the bottom, there are containers labeled D and E.
Liquid from A starts flowing downward and hits the black baffle.
The black baffle directs the liquid to the yellow baffle.
The yellow baffle further directs the liquid downward toward container D.
Liquid from B flows straight downward and hits the yellow baffle.
The yellow baffle directs the liquid downward toward container D.
Liquid from C flows straight downward and hits the pink baffle.
The pink baffle directs the liquid to the gray baffle.
The gray baffle further directs the liquid downward toward container E.
Liquid from A and B both flow into container D after being directed by the black and yellow baffles.
Liquid from C flows into container E after being directed by the pink and gray baffles.
Liquid from A and B will flow into container D, and liquid from C will flow into container E.
